title: macbook 12” early 2015
message: Hello i have a macbook 12” early 2015 that is not charging at all, I've tried a new charging port and also a charging port Flex with a new battery and it is still pulling 0 amps. Board  [SIZE=3][FONT=arial]<s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00045[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00045 fits a Macbook  computer from year 2015 whose model number is A1534 with a screen size of 12" and an EMC number of EMC 2746 [/INST]</s>-10   [/FONT][/SIZE]any recommendations on where to start

title: macbook 12” early 2015
message:
Not charging, or not starting at all???

Be aware, all these boards end with dead CPU...

title: macbook 12” early 2015
message:
Then let the baterry out.
You don't need it, until get the board starting on charger alone.

Post diode mode (red probe at ground) at [SIGNAL_NAMES]3V3_AON[/SIGNAL_NAMES] power rail.
Also check at <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PPBUS_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from.  [/INST]</s> and <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]3V3_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device.  [/INST]</s>.

USB-C meter is stuck at 5V?

title: macbook 12” early 2015
message: yes USB-C meter is stuck at 5V
